INGREDIENTS REQUIRED - 
• Boneless chicken (cut into 2 inch pieces 8-12) - 500 grams 
• Ginger-garlic paste - 2 teaspoons 
• Curd - ¼ cup 
• Malai/Cream - 3 tablespoons 
• Black salt - ¼ teaspoon 
• Cumin powder (roasted) - ¼ teaspoon 
• Soya sauce - ½ teaspoon 
• Orange or red colours - few drops 
• Salt - as required


INGREDIENTS FOR GARNISHING 
• Lemon juice - as required 
• Chaat masala - as required 
• Onion rings - as required


METHOD 
1. Wash the chicken pieces and pat dry on a kitchen towel. 
2. In a bowl mix curd, ginger garlic paste, malai, black salt, cumin powder, soya sauce (to give a dark colour) orange-red colour and salt. 
3. Add chicken. Keep aside in a cool place to marinate for 3-4 hours. 
4. Heat a gas oven or barbecue. Cook for 15-20 min, turning once in between with help of tongs. 
5. Baste (moisten) with little oil if needed. 
6. To cook in an electric oven, set temp to 180°C-200°C. 
7. Place the chicken on the wire rack (lower center) with a drip tray below. Cook till tender. 
8. Serve hot garnished with chat masala, lemon juice and onion rings.
